chargeHist.descr: Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm
Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Devale Deontae Randle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Great Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(a).
  • Child Abuse-High Probability/Great Harm, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
EACH COUNT:  Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those funds.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count three, but concurrent with current sentence.  Credit for 96 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

No further violations of the law.
No contact with victim during the entire sentence unless approved by agent.
No contact with firearms.

Complete Batterers Intervention program.
Attend parenting classes.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
AODA assessment. Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant:  of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition; must provide a DNA sample, and as a convicted felon  his voting rights are suspended and he may never possess firearms.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count two, but concurrent with current sentence.  Credit for zero days.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devale Deontae Randle in court with attorney Jean M. Kies.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  PSI reviewed, corrections made.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 15 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to Count 3, but concurrent with current sentence; credit for 96 days served.  Court ordered 10 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 5 YEARS Extended Supervision.
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 7 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to Count 2, but concurrent with current sentence; credit for 0 days served.  Court ordered 5 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 2 YEARS Extended Supervision.

Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend parenting classes.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim during the entire sentence unless approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.
rmm
from the defendant received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm

AS TO AMENDED COUNTS 2 and 3:  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

AS TO COUNTS 1 and 4-7:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered counts dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

At request of the parties, Court ordered presentence investigation with a recommendation. Order for presentence investigation filed; copy to Probation Dept.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.  Court advised the defendant the No Contact Order remains in effect. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Case adjourned to Branch 40 for Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Devale Deontae Randle in court with attorney Jean M Kies.  Defendant Devale Deontae Randle in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Amended Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Parties are ready to proceed to plea hearing. 

Count 1:  Physical Avuse of a Child (Intentional Causation of Great Bodily Harm), Repeater (as to the rib fractures) contrary to Wis. Stats. 948.03(2)(A), 939.50(3)(c), 939.62(1)(c), a Class C Felony. 

Count 2:  Physical Abuse of Child - Recklessly Cause Great Bodily Harm (as to leg fractures) contrary to Wis. Stats. 948.03(3)(a), 939.50(3)(e), a Class E Felony. 

Count 3:  Physical Abuse of a child (Intentional Causation, High Probability) contrary to Wis. Stats. 948.03(2)(c), 939.50(3)(f), a Class F Felony. 

Count 4:  Child Neglect (Bodily Harm), Repeater contrary to Wis. Stats. 948.21(1)(b), 939.50(3)(h), 939.62(1)(b), a Class H Felony. 

Count 5:  Substantial Battery (Substantial Bodily Harm with Intent to Cause Bodily Harm), Repeater, Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury contrary to Wis. Stats. 940.19(2), 939.50(3)(i), 939.62(1)(b), 968.075(1)(a)1 a Class I Felony. 

Count 6:  Misdemeanor Battery, Repeater, Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury contrary to Wis. Stats. 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), 939.62(1)(a), 968.075(1)(a)1, a Class A Misdemeanor. 

Count 7:  Misdemeanor Battery, Repeater, Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury contrary to Wis. Stats. 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), 939.62(1)(a), 968.075(1)(a)1, a Class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for 06-10-2014 at 08:30 a.m.  Jury trial scheduled for 06-30-2014 at 8:30 a.m.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Attorney Jean M Kies in court, defendant Devale Deontae Randle not in court, in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for trial.  Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 40.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Devale Deontae Randle in court with attorney Jean M. Kies.  Defendant Devale Deontae Randle in custody.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Defendant given a copy of the amended complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devale Deontae Randle in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Devale Deontae Randle in custody.  Catelin Autumn Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant AS TO MISDEMEANOR COUNTS 5 AND 6.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.
